column4: i tried to install vmware but i got this error from sudo apt-get update
this is the error
http://pastebin.com/m10b11dd2
It looks like you have both karmic and intrepid sources in your sources.list file.  What version of Ubuntu are you running now?
Then you should remove the ppa from /etc/apt/sources.list or change 'intrepid' to 'karmic' if you wish to keep the packages.
Rather, the repositories, not the packages.
how will i do that?
gksudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list
on terminal?
or from alt-f2
i'm here on the sources.list
Okay, do you see any lines that say intrepid?
Can you pastebin the contents of that file?
http://pastebin.com/m64537466
The last line has the ppa for AWN testing.  Change it to say karmic from intrepid.
then save?
yes.
i still got the same error message
i still got the same error message
run: gpg --keyserver keyserver.ubuntu.com --recv-keys 7D2C7A23BF810CD5 && gpg --export --armor 7D2C7A23BF810CD5 | sudo apt-key add -
done.....wats next!?
Then run apt-get update again
error message again..... invalid signatures: BADSIG 40976EAF437d05b5
Don't use the z argument if the file is not gzipped.
